page.title: 02INTRODUCTION TO WILLOUGHBY
page.content: Willoughby lies in the county of Leicestershire and is situated 10 miles away from the city of Leicester. There has been a village at Willoughby since before 1066 as it features in The Domesday Book under the name of Wilechebi .Willoughby was originally called Wilebi which means the homestead among the Willows by the water meadows.It was thus named because of the many springs that lay near the surface and the two rivulets that ran through the village. Today Willoughby Waterleys is a small agricultural village where mass modern development has been avoided. It comprises of farming and residential property with few facilities.This stucture helps to retain the peaceful and rural nature of Willoughby Waterleys.
